_description: Christine de Pisan, Anthony Babington’s translation of Christine de Pisan’s ‘Epistle of Othea’ — a Proheme of 24 stanzas rhyme royal and an Epistle, consisting of 100 sets of stanzas (in Text generally one stanza only) with prose Glose and Moralit

BLHar838.Editions:
Gordon,  James Daniel,
                        ed.  
             “The Epistle of Othea to Hector.” 
         Diss. University of Pennsylvania, 1942.
